reference_steps: Raw materials BaCO3, CaCO3, TiO2, and ZrO2 were accurately weighed according to stoichiometric ratio.
Weighed powder and moderate ethanol were mixed and ball-milled for 12 hours.
Mixture was placed into an oven and dried at 120°C.
After powder was completely dried, it was calcined at 1250°C for 5 hours.
Calcined powder was ball-milled again for 12 hours.
Ball-milled powder was pressed into desired size and shape by cold isostatic press machine at 30 MPa for 15 minutes.
Sample was sintered at 1400-1500°C for 4 hours to obtain dense ceramic plate.
For electrical property measurement, ceramic sample was sanded and polished to 0.6 mm thickness.
Ceramic plate was coated with silver paste on both sides and calcined at 600°C for 30 minutes.
Ceramic plate was polarized by DC bias of 2-3 kV/mm for 30 minutes at room temperature.
test_steps: Accurately weigh raw materials according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Mix the weighed powders with moderate ethanol and ball-mill for 12 hours.
Dry the mixture at 120°C.
Calcine the dried powder at 1250°C for 5 hours.
Ball-mill the calcined powder again for 12 hours.
Press the ball-milled powder into desired shapes using a cold isostatic press at 30 MPa for 15 minutes.
Sinter the pressed samples at temperatures between 1400°C and 1500°C for 4 hours to obtain dense ceramic plates.

method.test: not explicitly specified in the text

reference_steps: Dissolve zinc nitrate hexahydrate and hexamethylenetetramine in deionized water.
Transfer the solution to a Teflon-lined autoclave.
Heat the autoclave at 90°C for 10 hours.
Cool the autoclave to room temperature naturally.
Collect the product by centrifugation, wash with water and ethanol, and dry at 60°C.
Raw materials were mixed with alcohol and ball milled for 24 hours.
Calcined powder was obtained by heating at 1300°C for 3 hours.
BCZT powders were produced by a second stage of ball milling for varying time periods (1-12 hours).
BCZT ceramic slurry was prepared by mixing ceramic powder with light-sensitive oligomers, diluent, photo-initiator and dispersant using vacuum mixer for 300 s at 2500 rpm.
Ceramic slurry was poured into VPP printer to produce ceramic green body with 30 μm layer thickness.
Debinding of ceramic green body was completed in tube furnace at 425°C for 4 hours with temperature ramp rates of 0.1-0.3°C/min in argon atmosphere.
Sample was kept at 550°C for 2 hours to remove residual carbon during sintering process.
BCZT ceramic scaffold was obtained by heating at 3°C/min to sintering temperature (1380-1440°C) and furnace cooling after holding for 3 hours.
Sintered BCZT ceramics were polarized at 15 kV for 1 hour using corona poling technique.
ITO film was glued to both sides of BCZT scaffold with silver glue and cured for 12 hours at room temperature.
test_steps: Mix raw materials with alcohol and ball mill for 24 hours
Calcine the powder at 1300°C for 3 hours
Second stage ball milling of BCZT powders for specified durations (1h, 2h, 4h, 12h)
Prepare ceramic slurry by mixing ceramic powder with oligomers, diluent, photo-initiator, and dispersant using vacuum mixer
Pour slurry into VPP printer to produce green body with 30 μm layer thickness
Debind green body in a tube furnace at 425°C for 4 hours with controlled heating rates (0.1, 0.2, 0.3°C/min)
Sinter at temperatures of 1380°C, 1400°C, 1420°C, 1440°C with heating rate of 3°C/min to the target temperature, hold for 3 hours, then furnace cool
Polarize the sintered ceramics at 15 kV for 1 hour using corona poling
Glue PET film with ITO on both sides of the scaffold with silver glue
Cure the assembled sensor at room temperature for 12 hours

reference_steps: High purity chemical powders were weighed stoichiometrically and ball milled for 24 hours at 300 rpm with alumina balls using acetone as mixing media.
Mixed powders were dried in an oven, followed by calcination at 900°C for 3 hours.
Disc-shaped pellets were prepared using ~13 mm diameter under uniaxial pressure of 200 MPa.
Sintering was carried out at 1150-1200°C for 2-4 hours.
For XRD measurements, sintered pellets were grounded and annealed at 500°C for 1 hour to remove any strain.
For electrical property measurement, samples were thinned to ~1 mm and electroded on both sides using silver paste.
Samples were annealed at 500°C for 1 hour after electrode application.
Electrical poling was done by applying DC field of 4-5 kV/mm for 15-30 min in silicone oil bath.
test_steps: Weigh high purity chemical powders stoichiometrically.
Ball mill powders for 24 hours at 300 rpm with alumina balls using acetone as mixing media.
Dry the mixed powders in an oven.
Calcine the dried powders at 900°C for 3 hours.
Press the calcined powders into disc-shaped pellets (~13 mm diameter) under uniaxial pressure of 200 MPa.
Sinter the pellets at 1150–1200°C for 2–4 hours.
Measure the density of sintered pellets using Archimedes principle.
Ground and anneal the pellets at 500°C for 1 hour for XRD measurements.
Electroded the samples on both sides with silver paste and annealed at 500°C for 1 hour for electrical measurements.
Thinned samples to ~1 mm thickness for dielectric measurements.
Poling performed by applying 4–5 kV/mm DC field for 15–30 minutes in silicone oil bath.
Perform dielectric measurements using LCR meter over temperature range 25°C–600°C at various frequencies.
Measure piezoelectric coefficient (d33) with d33 meter.
Perform ferroelectric and strain measurements using loop tracer and strain setup at 1 Hz.
Conduct XRD measurements on Empyrean, Malvern Panalytical with Cu Kα radiation.

reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio of (1-x)(0.7BiFeO3-0.3BaTiO3)-x(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3-5 mol% Bi2O3 with x = 0.000, 0.001, 0.002, 0.003.
Materials were processed using traditional solid-state reaction method.
Ceramics were sintered to obtain final products.
Samples were poled for 24 hours at room temperature before electrical measurements.
test_steps: Weigh and mix the precursor powders according to the composition (1-x)(0.7BiFeO3-0.3BaTiO3)-x(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3-5 mol% Bi2O3 for x = 0.000, 0.001, 0.002, 0.003.
Ball mill the mixture to ensure homogeneity.
Calcine the mixture at an appropriate temperature to promote solid-state diffusion and reaction.
Press the calcined powder into pellets.
Sinter the pellets at high temperature to achieve densification and ceramic formation.

reference_steps: LNO precursor prepared by dissolving equimolar La(NO3)3 and Ni(NO3)2 in glacial acetic acid with ethylene glycol, stirred for 1 hr.
TiO precursor prepared by dissolving Ti-n-butoxide in glacial acetic acid with ethylene glycol, stirred for 1 hr.
PZT precursor prepared by dissolving Pb(CH3COO)2 in glacial acetic acid, adding Zr(OC4H9)4 and Ti(OC4H9)4 stoichiometrically with distilled water and ethylene glycol.
10 wt% polyvinyl pyrrolidone added to PZT precursor and stirred for 1 hr, then filtered.
Buffer layers deposited by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s on Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate.
Buffer layers annealed at 650°C for 30 mins.
PZT film deposited by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Two-step annealing process: 400°C for 2 mins, then 650°C for 2 mins.
Process repeated for 12 cycles to achieve ~1000 nm thickness.
Final annealing at 650°C for 30 mins in open-air atmosphere.
Pt top electrode deposited by DC sputtering for electrical measurements.
test_steps: Prepare 0.1 M solution by dissolving equimolar quantities of Lanthanum (III) nitrate and Nickel (II) nitrate in glacial acetic acid, add 0.01 M ethylene glycol, and stir for 1 hour.
Prepare 0.3 M solution by dissolving Ti-n butoxide in glacial acetic acid, add 0.01 M ethylene glycol, and stir for 1 hour.
Prepare 0.1 M solution by dissolving Lead (II) acetate in glacial acetic acid, then separately add stoichiometric amounts of Zirconium (IV) n-butoxide and Titanium (IV) n-butoxide, and stir.
Add appropriate amount of distilled water and ethylene glycol, stir for 30 minutes.
Add 10 wt% polyvinyl pyrrolidone, stir for 1 hour, then filter using Whatman filter paper.
Deposit buffer layers (TiO, LNO, LNO/TiO) on Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrates by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 seconds, then anneal at 650°C for 30 minutes.
Deposit PZT films by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 seconds, followed by two-step annealing at 400°C for 2 minutes and 650°C for 2 minutes.
Repeat the coating and annealing cycle 12 times to achieve ~1000 nm thickness, then anneal at 650°C for 30 minutes.

Characterize the crystallinity and phase via XRD, microstructure via FESEM, buffer layer thickness via FIB, grain size via image analysis, ferroelectric properties via Sawyer-Tower circuit, dielectric properties via impedance analyzer, leakage current via two-probe station, and temperature-dependent properties via hot-chuck.

reference_steps: K2CO3 and Na2CO3 powders dried at 150°C for 1 h before weighing.
Powders weighed according to compositions (K0.5Na0.5)xEu0.01NbO3 with x = 0.99, 1.00, and 1.01.
Weighed powders milled with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 hours.
Powder mixture dried at 100°C and calcined at 850°C for 4 h.
Polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) added to calcined powder as binder.
Green ceramics prepared by uniaxial pressing into pellets with 1 mm thickness and 10 mm diameter.
Green ceramics covered with same powder prior to sintering to prevent K and Na volatilization.
Ceramics heated to 850°C for 1 h to burn out PVA binder.
Final sintering at 1170°C for 3 h.
Silver paste applied to polished surface (600 µm thickness) followed by baking at 350°C for 30 min for electrical measurements.
Ceramics poled using 30 kV/cm DC electric field for 30 min at room temperature.
test_steps: Dry K2CO3 and Na2CO3 powders at 150°C for 1 hour.
Weigh powders according to compositions ((K0.5Na0.5) x Eu0.01NbO3 with x = 0.99, 1.00, 1.01).
Mill powders with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 hours.
Dry milled powders at 100°C.
Calcine powders at 850°C for 4 hours.
Add polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as a binder to calcined powders.
Press powders uniaxially into pellets with 1 mm thickness and 10 mm diameter.
Heat pressed pellets to 850°C for 1 hour to burn out PVA binder.
Sinter the ceramics at 1170°C for 3 hours.

reference_steps: Stoichiometric raw materials weighed for (0.994-x)(K0.48Na0.52)(Nb0.97Sb0.03)O3-0.006BiFeO3-xBi0.5Na0.5ZrO3 with x=0-0.12 mol%.
Raw materials ball-milled in alcohol for 24 hours to reduce particle size.
Mixed powder dried in hot air oven at 100°C for 24 h to remove residual alcohol.
Dried powder sieved to ensure uniform particle size and calcined at 900°C for 6 h.
Fine powder pressed into pellets using uniaxial pressing at 100-200 MPa pressure.
Pellets sintered at 1120-1140°C for 3 h.
Sintered pellets divided into two portions: one polished and ground into fine particles for composite film fabrication.
Other portion polished and painted with silver paste electrodes for electrical property testing.
For composite films: KNNS-BF-3BNZ ceramic powder dispersed in ethyl alcohol using sonication for 3 h.
Dispersed powder mixed with PDMS in various proportions (0-30 wt%) and combined with curing agent (10:1 ratio).
Mixture loaded into syringe and poured into prepared mold, placed at room temperature for 48 hours.
Dried KNNS-BF-3BNZ/PDMS film cut into 3×3 cm sheets with 3 mm thickness.
test_steps: Weigh raw materials according to stoichiometry.
Ball-mill raw materials in alcohol for 24 hours to reduce particle size.
Dry mixed powder at 100°C for 24 hours to remove residual alcohol.
Sieve the dried powder for uniform particle size.
Calcine the powder at 900°C for 6 hours.
Press the calcined powder into pellets using uniaxial pressing at 100–200 MPa.
Sinter the pellets at 1120–1140°C for 3 hours.
Disperse ceramic powder in ethyl alcohol using sonication for 3 hours.
Mix dispersed powder with PDMS in various proportions (0–30 wt%) and add curing agent (ratio 10:1).
Load mixture into a syringe, pour into mold, and cure at room temperature for 48 hours.
Cut dried composite films into sheets of 3×3 cm with 3 mm thickness.
Polish samples, coat with silver paste, and fire at 600°C for 30 minutes for dielectric, piezoelectric, and ferroelectric characterization.

test: Ferroelectric loop measurement (Radiant Precision Premier II)

matches.test_item: Ferroelectric loop measurement (Radiant Precision Premier II)

reference_steps: Powders of PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, Sm2O3, and Ta2O5 weighed according to [Pb0.09Sm0.01][(Zr0.54Ti0.46)1-xTax]O3 stoichiometry with x = 0, 0.01, 0.02, and 0.03.
Weighed powders subjected to wet-ball milling for 8 h.
Milled powders calcined at 850°C for 2 h.
Calcined powder sintered between 1150-1200°C for 2 h.
Ceramics coated with silver electrodes.
Poling performed in silicone oil at 150°C under 3 kV/mm electric field for 0.5 h.
test_steps: Weigh powders of PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, Sm2O3, and Ta2O5 according to required molar proportions.
Subject the weighed powders to wet-ball milling for 8 hours.
Calcine the milled powders at 850°C for 2 hours.
Sinter the calcined powders at 1150–1200°C for 2 hours to form ceramics.
Coat the sintered ceramics with silver.
Pole the ceramics in silicone oil at 150°C under an electric field of 3 kV/mm for 0.5 hours.

reference_steps: Raw materials Bi2O3, Fe2O3, BaCO3, TiO2 weighed for 0.69BiFeO3-0.31BaTiO3 composition.
Separate preparation of (0.8BNT-0.2BKT) using same solid-state method.
Weighed powders ground with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 h.
Powder mixture dried at 100°C for 12 h.
Powder calcined in air at 760°C for 6 h at heating rate of 2°C per minute.
8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) added to powder as binder.
Powder pressed under uniaxial pressure of 10 MPa to form discs with 8 mm diameter.
Samples sintered at 600°C for 3 h to remove PVA binder.
Final sintering at 970°C for 6 h.
Silver paste applied to surfaces and fired at 450°C for 30 min.
Silver-plated ceramic samples polarized in silicone oil at 110°C for 15 min using DC field of 5 kV/cm.
test_steps: Weigh raw materials and grind with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 hours.
Dry the mixture at 100°C for 12 hours.
Calcine in air at 760°C for 6 hours at a rate of 2°C per minute.
Add 8 wt% PVA as binder to the powder.
Press the powder into discs with 8 mm diameter under uniaxial pressure of 10 MPa.
Sinter the discs at 970°C for 6 hours.
Sinter at 600°C for 3 hours to remove PVA.
Apply silver paste to surfaces and fire at 450°C for 30 minutes.
Polarize the samples in silicone oil at 110°C for 15 minutes using a DC field of 5 kV/cm.

reference_steps: Raw materials Bi2O3, TiO2, Fe2O3, and Yb2O3 weighed in stoichiometric ratios for Bi5-xYbxTi3FeO15 compositions with x = 0.00, 0.02, 0.04, 0.06, 0.08, 0.10, 0.15, and 0.20.
Raw materials mixed and milled with ZrO2 balls in ethanol for 12 h.
After drying, mixture calcined at 750°C for 3 h to synthesize target product.
Calcined mixture ground, milled, and dried again under same conditions.
Resulting powder granulated with polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binders.
Powder pressed into disks 12 mm in diameter and 1.0 mm in thickness.
Each disk heated at 650°C to burn off PVA binder.
Final sintering at 1050-1060°C for 3 h at heating rate of 3°C/min in aluminum oxide crucible.
For electrical measurements, silver electrodes screen-printed on both surfaces of polished samples.
Silver electrodes fired at 570°C for 20 min.
Samples poled in silicone oil under DC electric field of 60-70 kV/cm at 150°C for 20 min.
test_steps: Weigh raw materials (Bi2O3, TiO2, Fe2O3, Yb2O3) in stoichiometric ratios.
Mix and mill the raw materials with ZrO2 balls in ethanol for 12 hours.
Dry the mixture after milling.
Calcine the dried mixture at 750°C for 3 hours to synthesize the target product.
Granulate the calcined powder with polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binders.
Press the granulated powder into disks of 12 mm diameter and 1.0 mm thickness.
Heat the disks at 650°C to burn off the PVA binder.
Sinter the disks at 1050–1060°C for 3 hours at a heating rate of 3°C/min in an alumina crucible to form ceramic samples.

reference_steps: High-purity raw materials Bi2O3, WO3, Nb2O5, and TiO2 weighed for Bi3Ti(1.5-x)NbxW0.5O9 compositions with x = 0.00, 0.01, 0.02, 0.04, 0.06.
Raw materials ball milled and crushed with zirconia balls using anhydrous ethanol as medium.
Mass ratio of raw material:ball mill media:anhydrous ethanol was 1:2:1.5.
Ball milling conducted for 24 h.
Samples pre-sintered at 800°C with holding time of 2 h.
Powder pelletized with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
Material aged for 24 hours, then subjected to pressure of 16 MPa.
Debinding process performed to remove PVA.
Final sintering conducted in muffle furnace at temperatures between 1010-1030°C.
For electrical measurements, samples coated with silver on both sides to form electrodes.
Samples placed in silicone oil at 160°C and subjected to DC field of 11-18 kV/mm for 30 min for poling.
test_steps: Mix precursors with zirconia balls and anhydrous ethanol in a mass ratio of 1:2:1.5
Ball mill for 24 hours
Pre-sinter at 800°C for 2 hours
Pelletize with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA)
Age the pellets for 24 hours
Apply pressure of 16 MPa and debond
Place in muffle furnace at 1010-1030°C for sintering

method.reference: molten salt method and templated grain growth (TGG)
method.test: molten salt method, solid-state reaction, ball milling, tape casting, sintering

reference_steps: [001]-oriented BTO template powders synthesized from Bi2O3 and TiO2 using molten salt method with equal molar ratio of NaCl and KCl in 1:1 wt ratio.
Template powder sintered at 1100°C for 1 h.
BTO matrix powders prepared by solid-state reaction with Bi2O3 and TiO2 weighed according to stoichiometric ratio.
Raw materials calcined at 700°C for 2 h.
Calcined powder ball milled for 48-72 h to achieve small particle size.
Template and matrix powders mixed by ball milling at ~60 rpm using xylene and ethanol as solvents.
5 vol% BTO template added to solution and stirred for 1 h to ensure homogenization.
Tape casting performed with blade gap of 210 μm.
After drying at room temperature for 8-10 h, tapes cut into 10 × 10 mm squares.
Squares laminated under pressure of 75 MPa for 1-3 h.
Organics burned off at 600°C for 3 h.
Green bodies heated in tube furnace from 650°C to 1000°C at rate of 10°C/min for texture evolution assessment.
Green bodies sintered in oxygen atmosphere at 950°C for 0-6 h for electrical property measurements.
test_steps: Synthesize [001]-oriented BTO template powders from Bi2O3 and TiO2 using molten salt method with NaCl and KCl in 1:1 wt ratio.
Sinter the template powder at 1100°C for 1 hour.
Prepare BTO matrix powders via solid-state reaction by weighing Bi2O3 and TiO2 according to stoichiometric ratio.
Calcine raw materials at 700°C for 2 hours.
Ball mill calcined powder for 48-72 hours to achieve small particle size.
Mix template and matrix powders by ball milling at ~60 rpm using xylene and ethanol as solvents.
Add 5 vol% of BTO template to the solution and stir for 1 hour for homogenization.
Perform tape casting with a blade gap of 210 μm.
Dry tapes at room temperature for 8-10 hours.
Cut dried tapes into 10×10 mm squares and laminate under 75 MPa pressure for 1-3 hours.
Burn off organics at 600°C for 3 hours.
Heat green bodies in a tube furnace from 650°C to 1000°C at 10°C/min to assess texture evolution.
Sinter green bodies in oxygen atmosphere at 950°C for 0-6 hours to measure electrical properties.

test: P–E and I–E hysteresis loop measurement

matches.test_item: P–E and I–E hysteresis loop measurement

reference_steps: Raw materials CaCO3, Na2CO3, Pr6O11, CeO2, Bi2O3, and TiO2 weighed according to stoichiometric composition for Ca1−x(Na0.5Pr0.25Ce0.25)xBi4Ti4O15 with x = 0, 0.05, 0.10, 0.15, and 0.20.
Powders ground using planetary ball mill for 12 h with anhydrous ethanol as solvent.
Ball-milling mixture dried at 70°C for 6 h.
Dried powders calcined for 4 h at 850°C.
0.2 wt% MnO2 added to calcined powders.
Calcined powders ground using planetary ball mill for 12 h and dried again.
6 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder added to calcined powders.
Powders pressed into discs under pressure of 6-8 MPa.
Discs heated at 600°C for 2 h to remove PVA.
Pellets sintered at 950-1050°C for 2.5 h in air.
During sintering, discs covered by their powders in sealed alumina crucibles to reduce volatility of Bi and Na.
For electrical measurements, samples poled in silicone oil bath at 180°C under DC electric field of 14-16 kV/mm for 30 min.
test_steps: Powders of CaCO3, Na2CO3, Pr6O11, CeO2, Bi2O3, and TiO2 were ground using a planetary ball mill for 12 hours with anhydrous ethanol as solvent.
The mixture was dried at 70°C for 6 hours.
Dried powders were calcined for 4 hours at 850°C.
0.2 wt% MnO2 was added to the calcined powders.
The calcined powders were ground again using planetary ball mill for 12 hours and dried.
A 6 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder was added to the powders.
The powders were pressed into discs under a pressure of 6–8 MPa.
Discs were heated at 600°C for 2 hours to remove PVA.
Pellets were sintered in air at 950°C–1050°C for 2.5 hours.

reference_steps: Raw materials Pb3O4, SrCO3, MgO, Nb2O5, TiO2, and ZrO2 mixed according to stoichiometric ratio and accurately weighed.
Materials ball milled for 18 h.
Dried powder calcined at 850°C for 3 h.
MnCO3 added to calcined powder with Mn content x ranging from 0 to 0.8 in 0.2 increments.
Ball milled for 18 h after MnCO3 addition.
Polyvinyl butyral used as binder to press dried powder into disks with 10 mm diameter.
Organics removed at 600°C for 3 h.
Green discs sintered at 1150-1250°C for 3 h.
For electrical measurements, both sides of sintered samples coated with silver electrodes and held at 550°C for 30 min.
Ceramics polarized in 150°C silicone oil with DC electric field of 3 kV/mm for 35 min.
test_steps: Mix precursors according to the stoichiometric ratio and accurately weigh.
Ball mill the mixture for 18 hours.
Calcine the dried powder at 850°C for 3 hours.
Add MnCO3 to the calcined powder and ball mill for another 18 hours.
Press the powder into disks with a diameter of 10 mm using polyvinyl butyral as a binder.
Remove organics by heating at 600°C for 3 hours.
Sinter the green disks at 1150-1250°C for 3 hours.
Coat both sides of the sintered ceramics with silver electrodes and hold at 550°C for 30 minutes.
Polarize the ceramics in silicone oil at 150°C with a DC electric field of 3 kV/mm for 35 minutes.

reference_steps: Precursors bismuth(III) nitrate pentahydrate, sodium acetate, potassium acetate, titanium(IV) butoxide, and manganese(II) acetate mixed in stoichiometric ratios for 3 mol% Mn-doped 0.8(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3–0.2(Bi0.5K0.5)TiO3.
Propan-2-ol and acetic acid used as solvents, with pentane-2,4-dione as polymerizing agent.
Mixture stirred at room temperature at 700 rpm.
Formamide added last for drying control.
Final 0.3 M solution allowed to polymerize for seven days before deposition.
6 layers of BNKT-20-3M deposited on commercial Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate via spin-coating.
Each layer spin-coated at 500 rpm for 10 s, then at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Heat treatments applied after each layer: evaporation at 200°C, pyrolysis at 500°C, and annealing at 750°C, each for 5 min.
After annealing, layer subjected to either fast quenching in liquid nitrogen (LNQ) or air-cooling (AC) to room temperature.
Process repeated 6 times to obtain thin-film sample approximately 220 nm thick.
Some samples further heat-treated in nitrogen atmosphere at 1 atm, 750°C for 30 min for defect passivation.
Circular Pt top electrodes with area of 0.283 mm² deposited by RF magnetron sputtering to create metal-insulator-metal structure.
test_steps: Mix precursors in their respective stoichiometric ratios.
Add propan-2-ol and acetic acid as solvents, and pentane-2,4-dione as polymerizing agent.
Stir the mixture at room temperature at 700 rpm for seven days to allow polymerization.
Deposit six layers of BNKT-20-3M on Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate via spin-coating at 500 rpm for 10 s and then at 4000 rpm for 30 s per layer.
Perform heat treatments including evaporation at 200°C, pyrolysis at 500°C, and annealing at 750°C, each for 5 min, repeating the sequence six times to achieve approximately 220 nm thickness.
Optionally, further heat-treat some samples in nitrogen atmosphere at 750°C for 30 min for defect passivation.
Deposit circular Pt top electrodes via RF magnetron sputtering in argon plasma to form MIM structure for electrical characterization.

reference_steps: Pure Mg substrate was mechanically ground with SiC paper up to 1000 grit and ultrasonically cleaned in ethyl alcohol.
Electrolyte was prepared with 20 g/L Na2SiO3 + 4 g/L KF + 2 g/L NaOH.
BaTiO3 powder (2 g/L or 5 g/L) was added to the electrolyte.
Mg plates were used as anode and stainless steel chamber as cathode during PEO process.
Pulse reverse power provided constant current of 2 A/dm2 for 660 s under frequency of 500 Hz and duty cycle of 15%.
Solution was cooled using water-cooling system at 30 ± 5°C during coating process.
After PEO treatment samples were rinsed in distilled water and dried in warm air.
test_steps: Preparation of electrolyte solution with 20 g/L Na2SiO3, 4 g/L KF, and 2 g/L NaOH.
Addition of BaTiO3 powder to the electrolyte at concentrations of 2 g/L and 5 g/L for PEO-BTO2 and PEO-BTO5 samples.
Mechanical grinding of Mg substrate with SiC paper up to 1000 grit, ultrasonic cleaning in ethyl alcohol, and drying.
Placement of Mg plates as anode and stainless steel chamber as cathode and reactor.
Application of pulse reverse power with a constant current of 2 A/dm² for 660 seconds at 500 Hz frequency and 15% duty cycle.
Cooling of electrolyte with water to 30 ± 5°C during coating process.
Rinsing coated samples in distilled water and drying in warm air.
Post-treatment: cross-section cutting, epoxy mounting, polishing, and characterization.

method.test: Chemical vapor deposition (CVD) or mechanical exfoliation

test_steps: Start with pristine MoS2 monolayer or bilayer, obtained via exfoliation or CVD.
Construct supercells of MoS2 with specified sizes (4x4, 3x3, 2x2).
Adsorb transition metals (Ni, Pd, Pt, Ir) onto the MoS2 surface at favorable sites, mainly TMo sites.
Vary the concentration of TMs by using different supercell sizes (4x4, 3x3, 2x2).
Relax the structures to minimize total energy and optimize atomic positions.
Calculate adsorption energies, bond lengths, and stability via AIMD simulations at 300 K for 5 ps.
Analyze the stability and charge transfer characteristics through AIMD and electron difference calculations.
Determine the stacking configuration (AA or AB) in bilayer MoS2 after TM adsorption, and analyze charge distribution and polarization effects.

reference_steps: NBT-0.6CeO2 powders (0.05-0.25 vol%) were dispersed in P(VDF-TrFE) matrix using 10 wt% DEC solvent.
Thin films were fabricated by spin-coating onto glass substrates pre-coated with aluminum electrodes.
Metal-insulator-metal structure was formed by depositing additional aluminum electrodes onto spin-coated films.
Samples were annealed at 100°C to optimize crystallinity.
For piezoelectric measurements, bulk samples were prepared by solution casting method with thickness of 30 μm.
Samples underwent DC poling at 65°C under electric field of 200 MV/m for 60 min in silicone oil bath.
Samples were slowly cooled to room temperature while maintaining electric field.
test_steps: Purchase P(VDF-TrFE) and diethyl carbonate (DEC).
Disperse NBT-0.6CeO2 powders in P(VDF-TrFE) matrix using 10 wt% DEC solvent.
Fabricate thin films by spin-coating onto glass substrates pre-coated with aluminum electrodes, with thickness depending on filler concentration.
Anneal the films at 100°C to optimize crystallinity.
Prepare bulk samples by solution casting method with a thickness of 30 μm for piezoelectric measurements.
Deposit additional aluminum electrodes to form MIM structures for dielectric, pyroelectric, and ferroelectric characterization.
Poling of samples performed at 65°C under high electric field (200 MV/m) for 60 min before piezoelectric measurement.

method.test: solvent casting followed by hot pressing

reference_steps: 1.74 g PVDF was dissolved in 20 ml N,N-dimethylformamide at 60°C.
10-50 wt.% BCT3 filler was added to solution after four hours of PVDF mixing in DMF.
Solution was stirred at 500 rpm on hot plate for additional four hours to achieve homogeneous distribution.
Solution was cast in cleaned petri dish and annealed in oven at 100°C for 5 hours.
Films were peeled off from glass petri dish and cut into square pieces.
Films were hot pressed at 100°C by applying 125 kg/cm2 pressure for two hours.
Silver electrodes were painted on both sides of films and heated on hot plate for one hour.
Films were poled by applying DC electric field of 100 kV/cm for 1 hour before PE measurements.
test_steps: Dissolve 1.74 g of PVDF in 20 ml of N,N-dimethylformamide at 60°C.
Add 10, 20, 30, 40, or 50 wt.% of BCT3 filler to the PVDF solution after four hours of mixing.
Stir the mixture at 500 rpm for an additional four hours.
Cast the solution into a petri dish and anneal at 100°C for 5 hours.
Peel off the films from the petri dish, cut into square pieces, and hot press at 100°C under 125 kg/cm² pressure.
Apply aluminum electrodes on top and bottom of the films.
Enclose the system with Kapton tape for protection.

reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to chemical formula and adequately ball-milled for 24 h.
Powder was pre-fired in muffle furnace at 780°C for 4h at heating rate of 2°C/min.
8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol was added as binder and powder was pressed into 8 mm diameter disks at uniaxial pressure of 12 MPa.
Disks were sintered at ramp rate of 2°C/min for 3 h at 600°C to remove PVA.
Final sintering was conducted at 1000°C for 6 h to obtain ceramic wafers.
Ceramic discs with double-sided silver electrodes were polarized in silicon oil at 120°C under DC field of 5 kV/cm for 20 min.
test_steps: Weigh raw materials Bi2O3, Fe2O3, TiO2, BaCO3, nano-Al2O3, and ZnO according to the chemical formula.
Ball-mill the weighed powders for 24 hours.
Pre-fire the powder in a muffle furnace at 780°C for 4 hours with a heating rate of 2°C/min.
Add 8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as a binder to the powder.
Press the powder into 8 mm diameter disks at a uniaxial pressure of 12 MPa.
Sinter the disks at a ramp rate of 2°C/min for 3 hours at 600°C to remove PVA.
Further sinter the disks at 1000°C for 6 hours to obtain ceramic wafers.
Polarize the ceramic discs by placing them in silicon oil at 120°C and applying a DC field of 5 kV/cm for 20 minutes.

reference_steps: Raw materials were ball milled with ethyl alcohol for 12 h at 300 r/min after weighing according to stoichiometry ratio.
Powders were dried in oven and calcined at 890°C for 6 h.
Powders were ball-milled again for 12 h.
Powder mixtures were dried, sieved, and pressed into pellets with diameter of 10 mm at 200 MPa using cold isostatic press.
Pellets were sintered in ambient air using two-step sintering technology.
Temperature was raised to 1190°C with heating rate of 10°C/min, then rapidly cooled to 1090°C and dwelled for 3-15 h.
Samples were placed in sealed crucible and covered with self-sourced powders to minimize volatilization losses.
Two sides of as-sintered samples were printed with silver paste and baked at 600°C for 30 min to form electrodes.
Samples were poled at 5 kV/cm for 30 min before piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Ball milling of precursors with ethyl alcohol for 12 hours at 300 rpm.
Drying the powders in an oven.
Calcining the dried powders at 890°C for 6 hours.
Ball milling the calcined powders again for 12 hours.
Drying and sieving the powders.
Pressing powders into 10 mm diameter pellets at 200 MPa using cold isostatic pressing.
Sintering the pellets by heating to 1190°C at 10°C/min, then rapidly cooling to 1090°C and dwelling for 3–15 hours before natural cooling.

reference_steps: Raw materials were mixed and calcined at 700-875°C for 5 h.
Calcined powders were re-milled for 24 h at 250 rpm using planetary ball mill with ethanol and yttrium stabilized zirconia balls.
Calcined powders were filled into cylindric Molybdenum die covered with graphite foil.
Water (5 wt%) was added dropwise before upper punch insertion.
Force of 45 kN (400 MPa pressure) was applied for 40 min with gradual temperature increase of 5°C/min reaching 200°C.
Thermal post-treatment at 850°C for 25 min with lower pressure of 245 MPa and heating/cooling rate of 10°C/min in vacuum.
Samples were re-oxidized for 6 h at 850°C in oxygen to equilibrate point defects.
Both sides of polished pellets were coated with platinum via sputtering for electrical measurements.
DC poling at 2.5 kV/mm for 30 min at 120°C for piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Mix raw powders of K2CO3, Na2CO3, and Nb2O5
Calcine the mixture at temperatures ranging from 700°C to 875°C for 5 hours
Re-mill the calcined powders for 24 hours at 250 rpm using planetary ball mill with ethanol and yttrium stabilized zirconia balls
Prepare powder-ethanol suspensions for PSD analysis
Perform DTA/TGA analysis on homogenized powders in air with heating rate of 3°C/min
Add water (5% weight fraction) dropwise to powders before pressing
Cold sinter the powders using SPS at 200°C under 400 MPa pressure for 40 min with gradual temperature increase of 5°C/min
Post-heat treat at 850°C for 25 min under 245 MPa with heating/cooling rate of 10°C/min
Re-oxidize samples at 850°C for 6 hours in oxygen
Ground, polished, and thermally etched samples at 800°C
Characterize phase and structure via XRD
Investigate microstructure via SEM
Perform grain size analysis using Image J
Prepare TEM specimens by grinding, dimpling, and Ar+ ion milling
Analyze TEM samples with TEM at 200 kV with EDS system
Measure dielectric permittivity and dielectric loss from room temperature to 500°C using LCR meter at multiple frequencies
Conduct impedance measurements from 100°C to 600°C over 0.1 Hz to 3 MHz with impedance analyzer
Measure ferroelectric hysteresis loops at room temperature using modified Sawyer-Tower circuit
Extract polarization-stress-electric field data at 10 Hz
Calculate coercive field, internal bias field, and piezoelectric coefficient d33*
Poling with DC electric field of 2.5 kV/mm for 30 min at 120°C
Measure d33 with Berlincourt d33-meter at 110 Hz 24 hours after poling
Perform unipolar strain measurements under 4 kV/mm electric field

reference_steps: Raw powders were weighed according to proportion of corresponding components.
Weighed materials and ethanol were poured into jar and ball milled for 24 h with ZrO2 balls.
Ball-milled powders were dried and calcined at 850°C for 6 h.
Raw powders were mixed according to proportion and ball milled for 24 h with ZrO2 balls again.
Dried mixed powders were granulated into floc with 8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol as binder.
Powders were pressed into disks (1 mm thickness, 10 mm diameter) under pressure of 10 MPa.
After removing PVA, disks were buried in calcined powders and sintered at 1150°C for 3 h in air.
Heating rate was 5°C/min from RT to 1000°C, then 3°C/min beyond 1000°C.
Both sides of sintered samples were mechanically polished and brushed with silver layer.
Samples with silver electrodes were processed at 600°C for 10 min.
Poling process was carried out in silicone oil at room temperature under electric fields of 5 kV/mm for 3 min.
test_steps: Weigh raw materials according to the desired composition.
Pour raw materials and ethanol into a jar and ball mill for 24 hours with ZrO2 balls.
Dry the milled powders.
Calcine the dried powders at 850°C for 6 hours.
Mix the calcined powders with the corresponding proportions of raw materials, add ethanol, and ball mill again for 24 hours.
Dry the mixed powders.
Granulate the dried powders into a floc with 8 wt% PVA as binder.
Press the granulated powders into disks (1 mm thick, 10 mm diameter) under 10 MPa pressure.
Remove PVA binder.
Buried disks in calcined powders and sinter at 1150°C for 3 hours in air.
Heat from room temperature to 1000°C at 5°C/min, then beyond 1000°C at 3°C/min.
Process samples with silver electrodes at 600°C for 10 minutes.

reference_steps: High-purity oxides were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio.
Powders were ball-milled in ethanol medium with zirconia balls for 24 h.
After drying in oven, mixture was calcined at 850°C for 3 h.
Calcined powder underwent additional 12 h ball milling process in ethanol.
Powders were dried and granulated by adding 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol.
Mixture was sieved through 80-mesh screen to obtain uniform powder particles.
Samples were crafted by uniaxially dry pressing powder mixtures with diameter of 10 mm and thickness of 1.5 mm.
Binder was removed at 550°C.
Samples underwent sintering at rate of 3°C/min, reaching temperatures between 1120-1200°C for 2 h in ambient air.
Green discs were coated with identical powder to prevent evaporation of Pb and Bi.
Ag electrodes were applied on both surfaces and fired at 600°C for 15 min.
Ceramics were poled under electric field of 4 kV/mm at 120°C for 20 min in silicon oil.
test_steps: Weigh high-purity oxides according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Ball-mill the powders in ethanol medium with zirconia balls for 24 hours.
Dry the mixture in an oven.
Calcine the dried mixture at 850°C for 3 hours.
Ball-mill the calcined powder in ethanol for 12 hours.
Dry and granulate the powder with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol.
Sieve the granulated powder through an 80-mesh screen to obtain uniform particles.
Uniaxially dry press the powder into pellets with 10 mm diameter and 1.5 mm thickness.
Sinter the pressed samples in ambient air at a rate of 3°C/min, reaching 1120–1200°C for 2 hours after binder removal at 550°C.
Apply Ag electrodes on both surfaces of the sintered ceramics and fire at 600°C for 15 minutes.
Pole the ceramics under an electric field of 4 kV/mm at 120°C for 20 minutes in silicon oil.

test: Electrical measurement system (for hysteresis, leakage current, piezoelectric coefficient)

matches.test_item: Electrical measurement system (for hysteresis, leakage current, piezoelectric coefficient)
Electrical measurement system (for hysteresis, leakage current, piezoelectric coefficient)
Electrical measurement system (for hysteresis, leakage current, piezoelectric coefficient)

reference_steps: Water-soluble metal salts were used as starting materials for hydro-evaporation synthesis.
After evaporation at 80°C, formed precursor precipitates were additionally heated at same temperature for 30 min to dry completely.
Dry precursor precipitates were ground in agate mortar to obtain precursor powders.
Precursor powders were calcined at 650°C for 3 h in air.
Ceramic powders were pressed uniaxially at 880 MPa in 6 mm die.
Samples were sintered at various temperatures (780°C or 835°C) for 3 h in air to achieve optimal compositions and microstructures.
Ceramic samples were sliced to 200 μm thickness for electrical measurements.
Samples were electrically poled at different electric fields during 1 s soaking time at room temperature.
test_steps: Dissolution of water-soluble metal salts in water to prepare precursor solutions.
Evaporation of precursor solutions at 80°C to form precursor precipitates.
Additional heating of precipitates at 80°C for 30 minutes to dry completely.
Thermal analysis (DSC and TGA) performed from 30°C to 800°C to determine optimal calcination temperature.
Calcination of precursor powders at 650°C for 3 hours in air to form bismuth ferrite-based compounds.
Pressing of calcined powders uniaxially at 880 MPa in a 6 mm die to form green compacts.
Sintering of pressed samples at various temperatures (780°C, 835°C, 870°C) for 3 hours in air to achieve dense ceramics.
Grinding and pulverizing of sintered samples for phase analysis.
XRD analysis performed to refine structure and phase composition.
FT-IR spectroscopy performed in ATR mode from 4000 to 400 cm−1 to analyze vibrational bonds.
Microstructure investigation using SEM with back-scattered electron detection.
Electrical characterization including hysteresis, leakage current, and piezoelectric coefficient measurements performed on sliced samples.

reference_steps: 99.9% pure chemicals were weighed and mixed in stoichiometric ratio according to formula.
Lead loss during heat treatment was balanced with 6 wt% PbO in each composition.
Sintered powder was made fine in agate mortar.
Methanol was added as dispersing agent and left for 1 h to ensure uniform mixing.
PVA (5 wt%) was added as binder with PVA-to-ceramic powder weight ratio of 1:20.
Powder was pressed into pellets using uniaxial hydraulic press at 150 MPa pressure for 3 min.
Calcination was repeated twice to achieve homogeneous and single-phase composition.
Sintering was carried out in air atmosphere at 1150°C for 4 h.
Flat surfaces of pellets were coated with gold and silver paint electrodes applied and heated at 600°C for 30 min.
Samples were poled using Belding & McLaren method by heating to 100-110°C in silicon oil and applying DC electric field of 20-30 kV/cm.
test_steps: Weigh and mix the precursors in stoichiometric ratio according to the formula Pb1-x-3y/2Bax Rey 3+ Nb2O6, with x=0.35 and y=0.00 to 0.06.
Add 6 wt% PbO to compensate for lead loss during heat treatment at 1250°C for 2 hours.
Add methanol as dispersing agent and stir for 1 hour for uniform mixing.
Add PVA (5 wt%) as binder with PVA-to-ceramic powder ratio of 1:20.
Press the mixed powders into pellets using uniaxial hydraulic press at 150 MPa with a holding time of 3 minutes.
Sinter the pellets in air atmosphere at 1150°C for 4 hours.
Cool the sintered samples and prepare for characterization.

reference_steps: Analytical reagents were mixed in stoichiometric ratios by ball milling with alcohol as solvent for 12 h.
Prepared powders were dried and calcined at 900°C.
Calcined powders were milled and dried again.
Powders were pressed into pellets using polyvinyl alcohol as binder.
Pellets were fired at 600°C to remove binder.
Samples were subsequently sintered at 1070°C-1170°C for 6 h under ambient atmosphere.
Sintered ceramic specimens were polished and coated with silver electrodes on top and bottom surfaces.
Optimal sintered specimen with highest d33 was selected through experimental trials by adjusting sintering temperature.
Ceramic specimens were poled in silicone oil at 4 kV/mm for piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Mix raw materials in stoichiometric ratios by ball milling with alcohol for 12 hours.
Dry the prepared powders.
Calcine at 900°C.
Press into pellets.
Fire pellets at 600°C to remove binder.
Sinter at 1070°C-1170°C for 6 hours under ambient atmosphere.
Polish and thermally etch the sintered ceramics to expose microstructure.

method.reference: template grain growth (TGG) with solid-state reaction
method.test: solid state reaction, tape casting, template grain growth

reference_steps: High purity precursors were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and mixed by ball-milling in anhydrous ethanol for 24 h.
Mixed powders were calcined at 850°C for 5 h to form main perovskite structure.
Slurry was prepared by mixing KNNS-(0.04-x)CZ-xBAZ matrix and NaNbO3 templates in ethanol/toluene co-solvent with PVB binder and MnO2 sintering aid.
Uniform slurry was tape casted to green tapes using doctor blade with thickness of 30-50 μm.
Green tapes were cut, stacked, and uniaxially pressed under 15 MPa at 70°C for 20 min.
Organic binder was removed at 600°C.
Samples were heated to 1190°C, then rapidly cooled to 1090°C and dwelled for 10 h.
Final textured ceramics were obtained after controlled cooling.
test_steps: Weigh high purity K2CO3, Na2CO3, Nb2O5, Sb2O3, CaCO3, ZrO2, Ag2O, and Bi2O3 powders according to stoichiometry.
Mix powders by ball-milling in anhydrous ethanol for 24 hours.
Calcine the mixture at 850°C for 5 hours to form the main perovskite phase.
Prepare slurry by mixing the calcined powders with NaNbO3 templates in ethanol/toluene with PVB binder and MnO2 sintering aid.
Tape cast the slurry into green tapes using a doctor blade with 30–50 μm thickness.
Dry the green tapes, cut, stack, and uniaxially press at 15 MPa at 70°C for 20 minutes.
Remove organic binder by heating to 600°C.
Sinter the pressed samples by heating to 1190°C, then rapidly cool to 1090°C and dwell for 10 hours.

method.test: Ball milling, calcination, cold isostatic pressing, two-step sintering

reference_steps: High-purity raw materials were weighed according to stoichiometry ratio of 0.957K0.48Na0.52Nb0.96Sb0.04O3-0.04Bi0.5Na0.5ZrO3-0.003CaZrO3.
Materials were ball milled with ethyl alcohol for 12 h at 300 rpm.
After drying, powders were divided into 4 batches and calcined at 800, 850, 900, and 950°C respectively.
Part of powders were pressed into compacts with diameter of 10 mm at 200 MPa using cold isostatic press.
Residual powders were subjected to another ball-milling for 24 h and pressed into pellets under same conditions.
All pellets were sintered using two-step sintering technique - rapidly raised to 1190°C at 10°C/min heating rate.
Temperature was rapidly cooled down to 1090°C and dwelled for 5 h before natural cooling.
For electrical measurements, samples were printed with silver paste and baked at 600°C for 30 min to form electrodes.
Samples were poled at 5 kV/cm for 30 min and aged for 20 h before testing.
test_steps: Weigh high-purity raw materials according to the stoichiometry ratio.
Ball mill the raw materials with ethyl alcohol for 12 hours at 300 rpm.
Dry the powders after milling.
Divide powders into four batches and calcine at 800°C, 850°C, 900°C, and 950°C respectively.
Press part of the calcined powders into 10 mm diameter compacts at 200 MPa using cold isostatic pressing (group A).
Ball mill the residual powders for 24 hours, then press into pellets under the same conditions (group B).
Sinter all pellets using a two-step sintering process: heat rapidly to 1190°C at 10°C/min, then cool rapidly to 1090°C and hold for 5 hours, followed by natural cooling.

reference_steps: Starting materials were mixed in stoichiometric ratios for Ba1-xSrxTi0.92Zr0.08O3 formula with x = 0, 0.04, 0.08, 0.12, 0.16, 0.2 mol.
Materials were subjected to ball milling in ethanol at 400 rpm for 12 h.
Mixture underwent drying and then fired at 1200°C for duration of 2 h.
After calcination, material was thoroughly blended with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
Mixture was compacted into discs measuring 15 mm across and 1 mm thickness by applying pressure of 10 MPa.
Molded ceramics were placed in muffle furnace, ramped to 650°C at rate of 5°C/min and held for 2 h to eliminate PVA.
Samples were heated to 1400°C at 5°C/min and sintered in air for 3 h.
For electrical characterization, ceramic surfaces were uniformly coated with silver paste on both sides.
Silver paste was cured by heating at 600°C for 30 min.
Ceramics were immersed in silicone oil bath at 40°C and subjected to polarization with DC field of 30 kV/cm for 20 min.
test_steps: Mix stoichiometric ratios of BaCO3, SrCO3, TiO2, and ZrO2.
Ball mill the mixture in ethanol at 400 rpm for 12 hours.
Dry the mixture after ball milling.
Fire the dried mixture at 1200°C for 2 hours for calcination.
Blend calcined material with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
Press the blended powder into discs of 15 mm diameter and 1 mm thickness at 10 MPa.
Place the pressed discs in a muffle furnace, ramp to 650°C at 5°C/min, hold for 2 hours to eliminate PVA.
Heat to 1400°C at 5°C/min and sinter in air for 3 hours to form ceramics.
Coat ceramic surfaces with silver paste and cure at 600°C for 30 minutes.
Immerse ceramics in silicone oil bath at 40°C and polarize with a DC field of 30 kV/cm for 20 minutes.

reference_steps: Raw materials were prepared for 0.725BiFe(1-x)ScxO3-0.275BaTiO3 ceramics with x = 0, 0.0025, 0.0050, 0.0075, 0.010, 0.015, 0.02.
Carbonates were dried in oven at 120°C for more than 2 h before use.
Raw materials were mixed by ball-milling machine in ethanol.
After drying, powder mixture was calcined twice at 800°C for 2 h.
Calcined powders were milled for 12 h and then pressed into disks with 12.7 mm diameter using polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as binder.
Green compacts were first fired at 600°C to remove PVA binder.
Samples were sintered in ambient atmosphere at temperature range of 1000°C-1020°C for 2 h.
Sintered disks were subjected to mechanical polishing to obtain thickness of ~0.35 mm.
Gold electrodes were sputtered onto ceramic surfaces for electrical measurements.
Ceramics were polarized at 120°C in silicone oil bath under DC electric field ranging from 5 to 6 kV/mm for 15-20 min.
test_steps: Dry BaCO3 in an oven at 120°C for more than 2 hours.
Mix raw materials in ethanol using ball-milling.
Dry the mixture after milling.
Calcine the dried powder twice at 800°C for 2 hours to ensure complete phase formation and homogeneity.
Mill the calcined powders for 12 hours.
Press the powders into disks with 12.7 mm diameter using PVA as a binder.
Fire the green compacts at 600°C to remove PVA binder.
Sinter the disks in ambient atmosphere at 1000°C–1020°C for 2 hours.
Mechanically polish the sintered disks to approximately 0.35 mm thickness.

reference_steps: 0.74 Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.26PbTiO3 (PMN-0.26 PT) single crystals were grown by modified Bridgman method.
As-grown single crystals were oriented by rotating XRD method.
[001]-oriented square slices were cut with size 4 × 4 × 0.8 mm³.
Layer of Ni was covered on (001) plane crystal slices to enhance binding force between single crystal and electrode.
Au electrode was sputtered on crystal slices for poling and electrical performance measurement.
All samples were annealed at 600°C for 10 h and then air-cooled to room temperature.
Samples were placed at room temperature for 2 days to completely release internal stress.
For electrical measurements, samples were poled using direct current poling (DCP) or alternating current poling (ACP) procedures.
During poling processes, single crystals were immersed in silicon oil to avoid arcing breakdown.
Electrical performance was measured 24 h after poling considering aging effect of materials.
test_steps: Grow single crystals of PMN-0.26PT using a modified Bridgeman method.
Orient the as-grown crystals using rotating XRD.
Cut [001]-oriented square slices with size 4×4×0.8 mm.
Cover a layer of Ni on the (001) plane crystal slices to enhance binding force.
Sputter Au electrodes on the crystal slices for poling.
Anneal all samples at 600°C for 10 hours.
Air-cool the samples to room temperature.
Place samples at room temperature for 2 days to release internal stress.
Perform electrical poling using DCP (direct current poling) at 25°C for 5 minutes.
Perform ACP (alternating current poling) with a symmetry triangular wave at 0.1 Hz, 14 kV/cm, for 5 cycles, monitored by oscilloscope.
Measure electrical properties 24 hours after poling.
Measure d33 with ZJ-4AN d33 meter.
Calculate electromechanical coupling coefficient kt using impedance resonance method with impedance analyzer.
Calculate dielectric constant using capacitance measurement at 1 kHz, sample area, thickness, and vacuum permittivity.
Determine d33* from S-E hysteresis loops.
Analyze phase structure with XRD.
Observe domain patterns with PFM.

reference_steps: AlN thin films were deposited by DC reactive magnetron sputtering from 100 × 300 mm² Al target (99.99% purity) using N2 and Ar as process gases.
Layers were deposited on 0.80-inch single side polished (100)-oriented Si substrates.
Substrates were cleaned in ultrasonic cleaning system: 5 minutes in Decon neutracon solvent, 5 minutes in WashBryte solvent, 5 minutes in deionized water.
Substrates were dried under N2 flow and loaded into deposition system under residual pressure around 10⁻⁷ mbar.
Al target was cleaned in pure Ar (flow of 30 sccm) at 300 W for 10 min to remove oxygen contamination.
Target was conditioned for 5 min in reactive atmosphere (Ar/N2 plasma) to reach stable reactive conditions.
AlN thin films were deposited using magnetron powers of 70-400 W and Ar & N2 flows of 20-40 sccm.
All experiments were conducted at room temperature with deposition time set at two hours.
Samples were characterized for thickness, morphology, crystallinity, and piezoelectric properties after deposition.
test_steps: Cleaning substrates in ultrasonic baths with Decon neutracon, WashBryte, and deionized water
Drying substrates under N2 flow
Loading substrates into deposition system under residual pressure (~10^-7 mbar)
Cleaning Al target in pure Ar at 300 W for 10 min to remove oxygen contamination
Pre-initiating plasma in Ar/N2 atmosphere for 5 min to stabilize plasma conditions
Depositing AlN thin films using specified magnetron power (70 or 400 W) and gas flows (20 or 40 sccm for Ar and N2)
Controlling deposition parameters via Design of Experiments (DoE) with upper and lower limits
Measuring film thickness and deposition rate by profilometry
Characterizing film morphology and composition with SEM and EDX
Studying crystallinity with XRD
Analyzing cross-sectional structure with TEM and STEM-EDX
Preparing TEM samples by lift-off method in FIB with platinum protective layer
Measuring piezoelectric d33 coefficient using Berlincourt method

reference_steps: Sodium acetate, strontium acetate, bismuth acetate, and barium acetate were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and added to ethylene glycol methyl ether and acetic acid solvents.
12 mol% excess sodium acetate and 2 mol% excess bismuth acetate were used to compensate for possible evaporation during high-temperature annealing.
Tetrabutyl titanate mixed with acetylacetone was added to the mixture of acetate.
Precursor solution was obtained after stirring the mixture at 80°C for one hour.
Solution concentration of 0.4 mol/L was achieved by adjusting the solvent content.
Solution was deposited on pretreated Pt/TiO2/SiO2/Si substrates by spin coating at 1500 r/min for 10 s and then 3000 r/min for 40 s.
Deposited film was placed in rapid thermal treatment furnace for pyrolysis at 150°C for 3 min and then at 410°C for 10 min.
Annealing process was conducted at 725°C for 3 min for crystallization.
Deposition and heating procedures were repeated 6 times to prepare thin films with designed thickness.
Au electrodes with diameter of 0.3 mm were prepared by DC sputtering.
test_steps: Weigh precursors according to the stoichiometric ratio with 12 mol% excess sodium acetate and 2 mol% excess bismuth acetate.
Add precursors to solvents and stir at 80°C for one hour to obtain precursor solution.
Adjust solvent content to achieve 0.4 mol/L concentration.
Deposit precursor solution on pretreated Pt/TiO2/SiO2/Si substrates via spin coating at 1500 r/min for 10 s, then 3000 r/min for 40 s.
Place coated films in RTP furnace for heat treatment: pyrolysis at 150°C for 3 min to evaporate solvent, then at 410°C for 10 min to remove organics.
Anneal films at 725°C for 3 min for crystallization.
Repeat deposition and heating cycle 6 times to achieve desired film thickness.
Prepare Au electrodes (0.3 mm diameter) on film surface by DC sputtering.

reference_steps: Weighed chemicals were wet-milled in polyethylene bottles with ZrO2 balls for 12 h in ethanol.
Materials were calcined at 750°C for 3 hours.
Calcined powders were milled, dried, ground, and granulated with polyvinyl alcohol binder.
Granulated powders were pressed into discs with diameters of 12.5 mm and thicknesses of 1.0 mm at pressure of 150 MPa.
Pellets were heated to 650°C for 60 min to burn out the binder.
Samples were sintered at 1080°C for 3 h.
Sintered samples were polished to thickness of approximately 0.5 mm.
Silver paste was screen-printed onto two parallel polished surfaces, followed by firing at 570°C for 30 min.
test_steps: Weighing of raw materials (Bi2O3, Fe2O3, TiO2, Ho2O3)
Wet-milling in polyethylene bottles with ZrO2 balls for 12 hours in ethanol
Calcination at 750°C for 3 hours
Milling, drying, grinding, and granulating with PVA binder
Pressing granulated powders into discs with 12.5 mm diameter and 1.0 mm thickness at 150 MPa
Heating pressed pellets to 650°C for 60 minutes to burn out binder
Sintering at 1080°C for 3 hours
Polishing sintered samples to approximately 0.5 mm thickness
Screen-printing silver paste onto polished surfaces
Firing at 570°C for 30 minutes

reference_steps: Precursors were dried for minimum of 12 hours in 120°C drying oven prior to planetary ball milling.
Ball milling was conducted in 100% ethanol with 250 mL ZrO2 milling jar and 5 mm ZrO2 media for 3 h at 125 rpm.
Resulting slurry was dried using rotary evaporator, ground with agate mortar and pestle, and sieved with 250 μm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Three individual calcination pellets with nominal weight of 3.0 g and diameter of 25 mm were uniaxially pressed under 5 MPa.
Calcination pellets were calcined in partially closed alumina crucible at 801.5°C for 4 hours with heating rate of 3°C/min and cooling rate of approximately 4°C/min.
Following calcination, pellets were milled in 100% ethanol with 250 mL ZrO2 milling jar and 5 mm ZrO2 media for 30 minutes at 125 rpm.
Resulting slurry was dried using rotary evaporator, ground with agate mortar and pestle, and sieved with 150 μm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Approximately 24 sintering pellets with nominal weight of 0.30 g and diameter of 10 mm were uniaxially pressed under 30 MPa.
Pellets were isostatically pressed under 200 MPa with dwell time of one minute.
Pellets were sintered in batches of 3 in partially closed alumina crucible at 1103.5°C for 2 hours with heating rate of 5°C/min and cooling rate of approximately 4°C/min.
test_steps: Dry precursors at 120°C for at least 12 hours
Ball mill in ethanol with ZrO2 jar and media for 3 hours at 125 rpm
Dry slurry using rotary evaporator, grind with mortar and pestle, sieve through 250 μm mesh
Uniaxially press into pellets (3.0 g, 25 mm diameter) under 5 MPa
Calcine pellets in muffle furnace at 801.5°C for 4 hours with heating rate of 3°C/min and cooling rate of ~4°C/min
Mill calcined pellets in ethanol for 30 minutes at 125 rpm
Dry, grind, and sieve through 150 μm mesh
Uniaxially press into sintering pellets (0.30 g, 10 mm diameter) under 30 MPa
Isostatically press pellets at 200 MPa for 1 minute
Sinter pellets in batches of 3 in alumina crucible at 1103.5°C for 2 hours with heating rate of 5°C/min and cooling rate of ~4°C/min
Thermally etch some pellets at 1037.5°C for 7 minutes to increase grain boundary contrast
Assess with SEM/EDX and bulk XRD

reference_steps: Powders were precisely weighed according to stoichiometric ratios and transferred to nylon tube for 12 h of ball milling in alcohol dispersing medium.
Mixed slurry was dried and calcined at 850°C for 4 h.
Calcined powder was subsequently milled again for 12 h.
0.3 g of ceramic powder was pressed into disc with diameter of 8 mm and thickness of 1.3 mm under pressure of 250 MPa.
Surface of green bodies was covered with ceramic powder of same composition and sintered in air at 1100°C for 4 h to obtain dense ceramic sheets.
Samples were polished to required thickness and platinum electrodes were applied and cured on both sides.
Samples were polarized in silicone oil bath at 180°C under electric field of 160-200 kV/cm for 30 min.
test_steps: Precisely weigh powders according to stoichiometric ratios
Transfer powders to a nylon tube for 12 hours of ball milling in an alcohol dispersing medium
Dry the mixed slurry
Calcine the dried powder at 850°C for 4 hours
Mill the calcined powder again for 12 hours
Press 0.3 g of ceramic powder into discs with 8 mm diameter and 1.3 mm thickness under 250 MPa pressure
Cover green bodies with ceramic powder of the same composition
Sinter in air at 1100°C for 4 hours to obtain dense ceramic sheets
Polish samples to 1 mm thickness for dielectric and resistivity measurements
Apply and cure platinum electrodes on both sides of the samples
For piezoelectric and ferroelectric characterization, prepare samples with 0.5 mm and 0.2 mm thickness respectively
Polarize samples in silicone oil bath at 180°C under electric field of 160–200 kV/cm for 30 minutes
Characterize physical structure and morphology using XRD, Raman spectroscopy, SEM, TEM
Measure dielectric properties with impedance analyzer, ferroelectric properties with ferroelectric test system, resistivity with electrochemical workstation
Determine piezoelectric coefficients using a quasi-static piezoelectric coefficients meter
Analyze elemental composition and valence states using XPS

reference_steps: Nonwoven ES fiber mats of P(VDF-TrFE) 80/20 were prepared from 12 wt% methyl ether ketone solution using electrospinning equipped with grounded rolling collector.

First thermal annealing (1A) process was performed by holding ES fiber mat isothermally at 140°C for various times (10, 60, 180, 360, 720, 1440, and 2880 min) to produce ECCs via chain-sliding motions in paraelectric phase.
Second annealing (2A) was carried out for ES1A-2880 min below TC with fixed isothermal time of 1 day at temperatures of 110, 115, 125, and 130°C to further increase ferroelectric domain size.
Corona-charging was employed to achieve permanent remanent polarization for piezoelectricity.
For corona-poling in water, methanol was used to wet fiber mats first and then replaced with water.
AC corona poling at 500 kHz was performed in water to avoid formation of ionic EDLs and potential electrolytic degradation.
After corona-poling in water, samples were dried in vacuum before characterization.
test_steps: Prepare nonwoven P(VDF-TrFE) 80/20 fiber mats via electrospinning from 12 wt% MEK solution.
Perform multi-step thermal annealing at 140°C for varying durations (10 to 2880 min) to induce ECC formation and increase crystallinity.
Monitor changes using DSC and SAXS to confirm melting of secondary crystals, increase in lamellar thickness, and high crystallinity (~80%).
Apply corona-charging to induce remanent polarization, with poling in air or water at room temperature for 30 min, using AC corona at 500 kHz in water to enhance poling efficiency.
Dry water-polled samples in vacuum, then measure piezoelectric properties.
Mixing of Ba, Ca, Ti, and Zr precursors in appropriate molar ratios based on the target compositions.
Grinding the mixture thoroughly to ensure homogeneity.
Calcining the mixture at high temperature to promote solid-state diffusion and formation of the perovskite phase.
Grinding the calcined powder to break up agglomerates.
Pressing the powder into pellets under high pressure.
Sintering the pellets at elevated temperature to achieve densification and desired crystalline structure.

method.reference: mixed oxide method with composite fabrication

reference_steps: BZT powder was prepared by calcining barium carbonate, zirconium dioxide and titanium dioxide at 1200°C for 2 h using mixed oxide method.
BZT powder was pressed into disc shape of ~15 mm diameter and thickness of ~1.5 mm at applied pressure of ~85 MPa.
BZT discs were sintered at 1450°C for 2 h.
BZT discs (dimension ~12 mm and thickness ~1.5 mm) were poled using electric field of 1.5 kV/mm at 50°C for 30 min in silicone oil chamber.
Poled BZT ceramic was cut using diamond saw in parallel direction along polarization axis using cut and fill method.
Mixtures of Portland cement powder, water (w/c ratio 0.35), epoxy resin and hardener (volume ratio 7.5) were prepared as matrix phase.
Mixture was filled into cut areas of BZT ceramic to create 1-3 connectivity composites with 40, 50, and 60 vol% BZT and 0, 3, 5, and 7 vol% epoxy resin.
Samples were cured in controlled chamber at 60°C for 5 days at 98% RH.
test_steps: Calcining barium carbonate, zirconium dioxide, and titanium dioxide at 1200°C for 2 hours to prepare BaZrxTi1-xO3 powder with x=0.05.
Pressing the calcined powder into disc shapes (~15 mm diameter, ~1.5 mm thickness) at approximately 85 MPa.
Sintering the pressed discs at 1450°C for 2 hours.
Poling the BZT discs using an electric field of 1.5 kV/mm at 50°C for 30 minutes in silicone oil.
Cutting the poled BZT ceramic using a diamond saw along the polarization axis.
Preparing cement paste by mixing Portland cement (ASTM Type I), water (w/c ratio 0.35), epoxy resin, and hardener (volume ratio of epoxy resin to hardener 7.5).
Filling the cement mixture into the cut areas of the BZT ceramic.
Curing the composite samples in a controlled chamber at 60°C for 5 days at 98% relative humidity.
Weigh and mix the precursors BaCO3, Bi2O3, TiO2 for BaBi4Ti4O15 and CaCO3, Bi2O3, TiO2 for CaBi4Ti4O15 in stoichiometric ratios.
Calcine the mixed powders at a suitable temperature (typically around 900°C) for several hours to facilitate solid-state reaction.
Cool the calcined powders to room temperature and grind to fine powder.
Press the powders into pellets under appropriate pressure.
Sinter the pellets at high temperature (around 1100°C) for several hours to achieve densification and phase formation.
Cool the sintered samples gradually to room temperature to obtain the final ceramic samples.
Mixing of precursors CaBi4Ti4O15 and Nb2/3Mn1/3 powders
Powder compaction into bulk specimens of dimensions 15 mm × 2 mm × 2 mm
Poling of specimens along the thickness direction

reference_steps: Raw ingredients were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and wet milled for 24 hours in ethanol medium using polyethylene bottles containing yttria-stabilized zirconia balls.
Milled precursors were dried in oven at 80°C overnight.
Dried powder was calcined at 1200°C for 4 hours in zirconia crucible.
Calcined powder was thoroughly ground in agate mortar to minimize particles and preserve appropriate homogeneity.
Combined powders were pelletized into disc-shaped samples using 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol binder.
Sintering was carried out for 4 hours at 1450°C at heating rate of 2°C per minute.
Sintered pellets were polished on silicon carbide paper.
Pellets were coated with silver paint on both sides and dried for 30 minutes at 600°C to facilitate electrical measurement.
test_steps: Weigh each powder according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Wet mill the mixture in ethanol medium for 24 hours using polyethylene bottles with zirconia balls stabilized with yttria.
Dry the milled precursors in an oven at 80°C overnight.
Calcine the dried powders at 1200°C for 4 hours in a zirconia crucible.
Pelletize the calcined powders into disc-shaped samples using 5 wt.% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
Sinter the pellets at 1450°C for 4 hours with a heating rate of 2°C per minute.
Polish the sintered pellets on silicon carbide paper.
Coat both sides of the pellets with silver paint and dry at 600°C for 30 minutes for electrical measurement.

method.test: not explicitly specified in the provided text

reference_steps: In2Se3@SnSe S-scheme heterojunction piezo-photocatalysts were prepared using two-step hydrothermal method.
SnSe displays typical nanoplate morphology while In2Se3 exhibits nanosheet structure.
Chemical reaction involving Se in SnSe produces In2Se3 during heterojunction formation.
All In2Se3@SnSe heterojunctions exhibit flower-like spherical structure.
Varying molar content of SnSe was used to create different compositions (In2Se3@SnSe-1, In2Se3@SnSe-2, In2Se3@SnSe-3, In2Se3@SnSe-4).
Heterojunction formation results in interfacial interaction and electron transfer from SnSe to In2Se3.
test_steps: Preparation of In2Se3 and SnSe materials
Formation of In2Se3@SnSe heterojunctions, likely involving chemical reactions between Se in SnSe and In2Se3 to produce flower-like spherical structures
Assembly of heterojunctions with varying SnSe molar content to explore microstructural changes
Characterization of the heterojunctions using XRD, SEM, TEM, XPS, UV-Vis absorption, PL, TRPL, photocurrent measurements, and other techniques

reference_steps: Raw materials were accurately weighed according to composition (1-x)(Ba0.95Ca0.05)(Ti0.89Sn0.11)O3-xBiFeO3 and milled with ethanol for 16 h.
After drying at 100°C, powders were calcined at 1150°C for 3 h.
Calcined powders were re-milled with ethanol for 16 h.
Powders were pressed into disks of 9 mm diameter using 3% PVA solution as binder.
Green bodies were fired at 600°C for 2 h and then sintered at 1400°C for 3 h.
Sintered ceramics were polished and coated with silver paste on top and bottom surfaces.
Silver-coated ceramics were fired at 800°C for 30 min to obtain electrodes.
Coated ceramics were poled at 50 kV/cm DC field for 30 min at room temperature in silicone oil bath.
test_steps: Accurately weigh raw materials according to the specified composition.
Mill the raw materials with ethanol for 16 hours.
Dry the powders at 100°C.
Calcine the powders at 1150°C for 3 hours.
Re-mill the calcined powders with ethanol for 16 hours.
Press the powders into 9 mm diameter disks using 3% PVA solution as binder.
Fire the pressed disks at 600°C for 2 hours.
Sinter the disks at 1400°C for 3 hours.
Polish the sintered ceramics and coat with silver paste on top and bottom surfaces.
Fire the coated ceramics at 800°C for 30 minutes to form electrodes.
Pole the ceramics at 50 kV/cm DC field for 30 minutes in silicone oil bath.

reference_steps: Li-doped BaTiO3 ceramics were synthesized with varying weight percentages of Li (0 wt%, 2 wt%, and 4 wt%) using solvothermal approach
Powders were pressed into pellets for dielectric measurements
Pellets were sintered in closed environment at 1100°C for 2 hours
Care was taken to minimize lithium loss during sintering by covering samples with crucibles
test_steps: Synthesize Li-doped BaTiO3 ceramics with varying Li content (0 wt%, 2 wt%, 4 wt%) using solvothermal approach.
Press the powders into pellets.
Sinter the pellets in a closed environment at 1100°C for 2 hours.
Perform Rietveld refinement to confirm single-phase tetragonal structure.
Conduct elemental analysis to confirm the presence of barium and titanium.
Use Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) to observe nanoparticle formation and measure particle size.
Analyze SAED patterns with CrysTBox software to confirm polycrystalline nature.

reference_steps: Stoichiometric ratios of high-purity precursors BaCO3, CaCO3, ZrO2, SnO2, and TiO2 were mixed.
Combinations were ground for 2 hours in mortar and pestle.
Materials were ball milled for 4 hours in ethanol solution with zirconia balls in low-energy ball mill.
Resulting solutions were dried and obtained lumps were pulverized.
Powders were calcined for 4 hours at 1200°C in air ambient.
Resulting granulated powders were reground.
1 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was added as organic binder.
Materials were molded into disk-shaped pellets (1 mm thick and 10 mm diameter).
Pellets were heated for 1 hour at 650°C at rate of 1°C per minute to burn off PVA binder.
Binder-free pellets underwent sintering for 4 hours at 1400°C in air.
Sintered pellets were electroded on opposite faces with conducting silver paste for electrical measurements.
test_steps: Mix high-purity precursors in stoichiometric ratios.
Grind the mixture in a mortar and pestle for 2 hours.
Mill the mixture for 4 hours in ethanol with zirconia balls using a low-energy ball mill.
Dry the milled solution and pulverize lumps.
Calcine the pulverized powders at 1200°C for 4 hours in air.
Regrind the calcined powders and mold into disk-shaped pellets (1 mm thick, 10 mm diameter) with 1 wt% PVA binder.
Heat the pellets at 650°C for 1 hour at 1°C/min to burn off PVA binder.
Sinter the binder-free pellets simultaneously at 1400°C for 4 hours in air.

reference_steps: Mixed 1 g colemanite, 80 mg Fe2O3, 500 mg BaCO3, and 500 mg TiO2.
Subjected mixture to ball milling for 15 h at rotational speed of 300 rpm.
Added 2 mL of 13.8 M ammonia solution to mixture and ball-milled for additional 3 min at same speed.
Transferred resulting mixture onto silicon carbide plate (3 cm × 2 cm).
Evaporated ammonia solution by heating plate on hot plate set to 150°C.
Placed SiC plate with residual mixture into tubular furnace.
Gradually increased furnace temperature to 1300°C and maintained for 3 h under continuous NH3 gas flow.
Stopped NH3 gas flow at 975°C upon completion of reaction.
Allowed furnace to cool to room temperature.
Carefully removed composite material from SiC plate for characterization.
test_steps: Mix 1 g colemanite, 80 mg Fe2O3, 500 mg BaCO3, and 500 mg TiO2.
Ball mill the mixture for 15 hours at 300 rpm.
Add 2 mL of 13.8 M ammonia solution to the milled mixture.
Ball mill for an additional 3 minutes at the same rotational speed.
Transfer the mixture onto a silicon carbide plate (3 cm x 2 cm).
Evaporate ammonia by heating the plate on a hot plate at 150°C.
Place the residual mixture with the SiC plate into a tubular furnace.
Heat the furnace gradually to 1300°C and maintain for 3 hours under NH3 flow.
Stop NH3 flow at 975°C and allow the furnace to cool to room temperature.
Collect the composite from the SiC plate.

reference_steps: Raw materials CeO2, Bi2O3, TiO2, and Nb2O5 were weighed according to BTN-100xCe nominal composition.
Materials were ball mixed for 24 hours with anhydrous ethanol and zirconia balls medium.
Mixed slurries were separated from balls and dried.
Dried materials were calcined at 800°C for 3 hours.
Calcined materials were ball milled for 24 hours again and dried.
Dried powders were granulated with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol solution as adhesive.
Granulated powders were pressed into green pellets of 13 mm diameter and 1.0 mm thick under 120±10 MPa pressure.
Green pellets were fired at 650°C for 3 hours to burn off PVA.
Pellets were sintered at 1065-1105°C for 3 hours in air with 5°C/min heating rate.
Sintered samples were furnace-cooled to ambient temperature.
test_steps: Weigh raw materials according to the nominal composition of Bi3-xCexTiNbO9.
Ball mix the raw materials with anhydrous ethanol and zirconia balls medium for 24 hours.
Separate the balls, dry the mixed slurry.
Calcine the dried powders at 800°C for 3 hours.
Ball mill the calcined powders again for 24 hours.
Granulate the dried powders using polyvinyl alcohol (PVA, 5 wt%) as adhesive.
Press the granulated powders into green pellets of 13 mm diameter and about 1.0 mm thickness under a pressure of 120 ± 10 MPa.
Fire the green pellets at 650°C for 3 hours to burn off PVA.
Sinter the fired pellets at 1065°C–1105°C for 3 hours in air with a heating rate of 5°C/min, followed by furnace cooling to ambient temperature.
